titleStmt.title: The Abyssinian philosophy confuted, or, Tellvris theoria neither sacred not agreeable to reason being for the most part a translation of Petrus Ramazzini, Of the wonderful springs of Modena : illustrated with many curious remarks and experiments by the author and translator : to which is added a new hypothesis deduced from Scripture and the observation of nature : with an addition of some miscellany experiments / by Robert St. Clair ...
Defontium Mutinènsium admiranda scaturgine tractatus physico-hydrostaticis. English
titleStmt.author: Ramazzini, Bernardino, 1633-1714.

titleStmt.title: The Abyssinian philosophy confuted, or, Tellvris theoria neither sacred not agreeable to reason being for the most part a translation of Petrus Ramazzini, Of the wonderful springs of Modena : illustrated with many curious remarks and experiments by the author and translator : to which is added a new hypothesis deduced from Scripture and the observation of nature : with an addition of some miscellany experiments / by Robert St. Clair ...
Defontium Mutinènsium admiranda scaturgine tractatus physico-hydrostaticis. English
titleStmt.author: Ramazzini, Bernardino, 1633-1714.
St. Clair, Robert N.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author and sold by W. Newton ...,

notesStmt.note: Signatures a7-8 and a10-11 are tightly bound; a9 is torn with loss of text; A1 is missing in filmed copy. Beginning-B7 and c5-B1 photographed from Bodleian Library copy and inserted at end.
Reproduction of original in National Library of Scotland (Advocates')
